references.paper_title: Stacked U-Nets with Self-Assisted Priors towards Robust Correction of Rigid Motion Artifact in Brain MRI
references.reason: This paper proposes a deep learning method for 3D motion correction in MRI, similar to the method presented in this paper, making it a key comparative method.

references.paper_title: Sensitivity Encoding for Aligned Multishot Magnetic Resonance Reconstruction
references.reason: This paper presents a classical model-based approach for motion correction in MRI, providing a strong baseline to compare against the deep-learning approach proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Three-Dimensional Motion Corrected Sensitivity Encoding Reconstruction for Multi-Shot Multi-Slice MRI: Application to Neonatal Brain Imaging
references.reason: This paper extends the model-based method to 3D MRI, demonstrating the challenges and potential of this approach compared to the proposed approach in this paper.
This foundational paper introduces compressed sensing techniques for MRI, providing the theoretical basis for many modern MRI reconstruction methods, including those compared in this paper.

references.paper_title: U-Net: Convolutional Networks for Biomedical Image Segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces the U-Net architecture, a widely used deep learning model for image segmentation, which forms the basis of the reconstruction network used in this paper.
